intro: Scorzonera lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-haired scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a hairy stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, whitish pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Scorzonera lasiocarpa is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
